context/3: Well, maybe
context/4: Silly, it never occurred to me.
context/8: You've had parachute training?
context/9: There's sufficient clearing to make your jump at last light.

context: If I have to go into court, that cop will tell everything he heard today.
response: And you won't stand a chance.
context/0: You really got yourself into trouble now.
context/1: I saw that one coming from way back.
context/2: I thought you had better sense.
context/3: That was a dirty trick you tried to pull before.
context/7: That's the best advice I can give you.
context/8: Okay.

context: You're right.
response: We'll do that.
context/0: Eduardo, why don't we leave the country and forget this.
context/3: That's not good news.
context/5: I'll aid you as soon as possible.
context/6: If you are in trouble, you can call me.
context/7: I'll leave you a radio watch.
context/8: I have to go now.
context/9: Their dead partners are crying out for vengeance.

context: Lieutenant Hewitt is here, sir.
response: Oh, send him right in.
context/0: Come in.
context/2: That old Chivington sure gonna be disappointed not to have somebody to shoot at.
context/3: Next time, obey the treaty.
context/4: In peace we return to our farms and women at Sand Creek.
context/5: To the south, we trade with our brothers.
context/6: We search for those who have done this.
context/7: In the north, there have been many ranches burned, people murdered.
context/8: No guns, no bows and arrows.
context/9: Says you can't leave the reservation without permission.

context: You've got to use their momentum.
response: All right.
context/0: Get over there, Martin.
context/1: That's not the way I showed you.
context/3: Hold it!
context/5: You've got to brace your feet, girls.
context/8: Can't you think of a more pleasing arrangement for the both of us?
context/9: General, this ain't the kinda work I'm accustomed to.

context: It's not good to have too many people know about a hoard of gold.
response: Or women.
context/3: Oh, no.
context/4: I'm afraid I really must, old boy.
context/8: No.

context: My-- my sister passed out.
response: All the kids were screaming their heads off.
context/0: A fine trick the play on people.
context/3: Se how the others was takin' it.
context/4: Sure me and the old woman was runnin' down the streets, mingled with the crowds, but we wasn't scared ourselves, just for the kicks.
context/5: I knew it was a play all the time.
context/8: Well, many laughed, with perhaps just a touch of historical relief in their laughter.

context: Well, we're in trouble.
response: For what?
context/0: Shall we go?
context/1: That's just what I was thinking.
context/2: I think that concludes our business, officer.
context/3: Goodbye.
context/4: I'll call you later at home.
context/6: Now the police can't find him.
context/7: Well, the doctor declared him dead, but he must've been only unconscious.
context/8: What happened?

context: To report at an early date.
response: No, I'm afraid the public won't accept that in this case, Sergeant.
context/0: However, you may say that we expect to have something definite...
context/1: What we might know and what we're able to tell you are two different things.
context/2: You've made no progress so far.
context/3: So you better produce some results, eh, Sergeant.
context/5: I've been told to stick with this story till it's solved.
context/6: The senseless wantonness of these killings has everybody talking about them.
context/7: It's kicked up an awful stir.
context/8: Yes, I have.
context/9: You've read the papers, I suppose?
